name: sucexg

stmt.origin: sylib(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csuc(c0), universe), wcel(c0, universe))
stmt.pretty: sylib(c0 ∈ c1, suc(c0)∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csuc(c0), universe))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, universe))
-| wb(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(csuc(c0), universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csuc(c0), universe))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, universe))
-| wb(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(csuc(c0), universe))

|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(csuc(c0), universe))
-| wb(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(csuc(c0), universe))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → suc(c0)∈ 𝕌)
⊣ (c0 ∈ 𝕌 ↔ suc(c0)∈ 𝕌)

comment: The successor of a set is a set (generalization). (Contributed by NM, 5-Jun-1994.)
